# Data process




## South Africa

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description


| **Name** | `q2525`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `q2525: recall 1`|
| **Table name** |`southAfricaINDdata`|
| **Categories** |`Continuous Variable 0-10`|
| **Missings** | `-8 = don't know`<br/>`NA` |
| **Description** |  |


```{r assign Africa w1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'SAGE_Africa_w1_cog_imm','SAGE.southAfricaINDdata', variables=list('q2525'), missings = TRUE)
SAGE_Africa_w1_cog_imm <- opal.execute(o,'SAGE_Africa_w1_cog_imm')
```

```{r local Africa w1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- SAGE_Africa_w1_cog_imm$q2525
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(-8))[3], caption = "Immediate recall continuous")
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(-8))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(-8))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(SAGE_Africa_w1_cog_imm, aes(x=factor(q2525))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Cognition - Immediate recall") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable `cog_imm_c` from the study-specific variable the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `-8 Don't know into 998`
* `NA into 999`

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_imm` from `cog_imm_c` it has to be recoded as follows:

* `cog_imm_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_imm_c >25% into 1`

**R script**

```{r harmo Africa w1}
##cog_imm_c
SAGE_ds_SA_w1 <- tibble(id=SAGE_Africa_w1_cog_imm$id)
SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm_c <- car::recode(SAGE_Africa_w1_cog_imm$q2525, "-8 = '998';NA = '999' ")
SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm_c <- labelled(SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm_c, labels = c(Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))

##cog_imm
Q <- quantile(car::recode(SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm_c, "999=NA; 998=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm <- car::recode(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm <- labelled(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript Africa w1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm_c
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_cog_imm_c)
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(SAGE_ds_SA_w1, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vari <- SAGE_ds_SA_w1$cog_imm
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_cog_imm)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(SAGE_ds_SA_w1, aes(x=factor(cog_imm))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation Africa w1, echo=FALSE}
Continuous <- c(sum(na.omit(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[2]])<=Q), sum(na.omit(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[2]])>Q & na.omit(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[2]])<900), sum(na.omit(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[2]])==998), sum(na.omit(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[2]])==999))
Dichotomic <- table(SAGE_ds_SA_w1[[3]], useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(Continuous,Dichotomic)
colnames(C) <- c("0:4->0","5:10->1", "-8->998","NA->999") 
kable(C, caption = "Continuous vs Dichotomous")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable `cog_imm_c` from the study-specific variable the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `-8 Don't know into 998`
* `-9 Not applicable into 996`
* `NA into 999`

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_imm` from `cog_imm_c` it has to be recoded as follows:

* `cog_imm_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_imm_c >25% into 1`

**R script**

```{r harmo Russia w1}
##cog_imm_c
SAGE_ds_russia_w1 <- tibble(id=SAGE_Russia_w1_cog_imm$id)
SAGE_ds_russia_w1$cog_imm_c <- car::recode(SAGE_Russia_w1_cog_imm$q2525, "-8 = 998; -9 = 996; NA = 999")
SAGE_ds_russia_w1$cog_imm_c <- labelled(SAGE_ds_russia_w1$cog_imm_c, labels = c(Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))

##cog_imm
Q <- quantile(car::recode(SAGE_ds_russia_w1$cog_imm_c, "999=NA; 996=NA;998=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

SAGE_ds_russia_w1$cog_imm <- car::recode(SAGE_ds_russia_w1[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
SAGE_ds_russia_w1$cog_imm <- labelled(SAGE_ds_russia_w1[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab = ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- labelled(aux_object[[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label[1:(length(cat_label)-9)])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


labelling_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab=ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with continuous data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- m.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cont_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- remove_val_labels(aux_object[[vbl_name]])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name = hd_vbl){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[2+length(cat_label),] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Creation of summary tables for continuous data

summaries_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of column with summary table categories
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[1:6]
  # Adding of missing/no-missing values categories
  t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[vbl_name]], missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    # First, summary values
    t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[1:6]
    # Next, missing/no-missing values (the 1 in $values_table[1,] stands for absolute values, while a 2 would stand for percentages)
    t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[vbl_name]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))
  # Add wave/population names
  dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name]))[[2]],lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name = hd_vbl){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }
  
}
```
